subject: Mental Health
title: Genetics and Eating Disorders
description: Learn Genetics and Eating Disorders in one minute.

hook.text: If your identical twin has anorexia, your risk is 50 to 80 percent. Genes matter.

buildup.text: Genome-wide studies have identified multiple genes linked to eating disorder risk.

discovery.text: These genes overlap with those for anxiety, depression, OCD, and metabolism.

twist.text: Anorexia has genetic links to both psychiatric traits and metabolic factors like low BMI.

climax.text: Genetics loads the vulnerability, but environment and culture pull the trigger.

punchline.text: You inherit the risk. You don't inherit the destiny.

quiz.question: What is the heritability risk if an identical twin has anorexia?
